results.title: How the Pandemic Left the $25 Billion Hudson Yards Eerily Deserted
results.abstract: The largest private development in U.S. history has attracted marquee companies, but is struggling with unsold luxury condos and a mall barren of shoppers.
results.byline: BY MATTHEW HAAG AND DANA RUBINSTEIN

multimedia.caption: The company that built Hudson Yards had said the entire project would be finished in 2024. It no longer offers an estimated completion date.
multimedia.copyright: Todd Heisler/The New York Times

results.title: Supreme Court Partly Backs Religious Challenge to California Virus Restrictions
results.abstract: The ruling followed a similar one in a case from New York and provided more evidence of a change in the court’s direction after the death of Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg.

multimedia.caption: In a brief, unsigned opinion late Friday night, the Supreme Court left in place a 25 percent capacity restriction and a prohibition on singing and chanting in religious services in California.
multimedia.copyright: Adam Beam/Associated Press

results.title: Britt Reid, a Chiefs Assistant Coach, Is Involved in a Car Crash
results.abstract: The team released a statement confirming that Reid, the son of Kansas City’s head coach, Andy Reid, had been in an accident but provided no other details.

results.title: Feud Between Hollywood Agents and TV Writers Comes to an End
results.abstract: A fight over conflict-of-interest claims began nearly two years ago. William Morris Endeavor was the last major agency to reach a new agreement.

multimedia.caption: William Morris Endeavor, which is controlled by a company run by Ariel Emanuel, reached an agreement on Friday with the Writers Guild of America.

results.title: Biden Bars Trump From Receiving Intelligence Briefings, Citing ‘Erratic Behavior’
results.abstract: Mr. Biden said there was “no need” for former President Donald J. Trump to get the briefings, traditionally given to ex-presidents as a courtesy and to keep them informed if their advice is needed.

results.title: I.C.C. Rules It Has Jurisdiction to Examine Possible Israel War Crimes
results.abstract: The International Criminal Court on Friday said it has the authority to investigate alleged crimes in the occupied territories, in a ruling condemned by Israel and praised by Palestinians.

multimedia.caption: Israeli tanks near the border with Gaza in 2014. The International Criminal Court’s ruling comes six years after it began its investigation of Israeli actions in the 50-day Gaza war.
multimedia.copyright: Sergey Ponomarev for The New York Times

results.title: Biden says he will bar Trump from receiving intelligence briefings, saying his ‘erratic behavior’ cannot be trusted.
results.abstract: President Biden said the former president’s behavior worried him “unrelated to the insurrection” that gave rise to the second impeachment of Donald J. Trump.

results.title: Last Undecided House Race Finally Goes to Republican, by 109 Votes
results.abstract: Claudia Tenney, a Republican from Central New York, regained a seat she lost in 2018 after a judge ruled that her 109-vote victory was legitimate.

multimedia.caption: The ruling will allow Claudia Tenney to return to Washington, where she established herself as a close ally of President Donald J. Trump, but also alienated some voters with her divisive stances and rhetoric.
multimedia.copyright: Heather Ainsworth for The New York Times
